import React, { useEffect, useState } from "react"; import { useDispatch,useSelector } from "react-redux"; import { useParams } from 'react-router-dom'; import * as ProductActions from '../../store/products' import "./editProducts.css" function EditProduct() { const {product_id} = useParams() const product_id_num = Number(product_id) // const product = useSelector(state =>state.products.singleProduct) const [result,setResult]=useState({}) console.log("the result is ",result) const dispatch = useDispatch() const [price,setPrice] = useState(result?.price || 0) const [image,setImage]=useState(null) const [image1,setImage1]=useState(null) const [image2,setImage2]=useState(null) const [image3,setImage3]=useState(null) const [handmade , setHandmade]=useState(result?.handmade || false) const [vintage , setVintage]=useState(result?.vintage || false) const [madeToOrder , setmadeToOrder]=useState(result?.made_to_order || false) const [creator , setCreator]=useState(result?.creator || "") const [title , setTitle]=useState(result?.title || "") const [material,setMaterial] = useState(result?.material || "") const [description,setDescription]=useState(result?.description || "") const [userId,setUserId] = useState(result?.user_id || 1) const [imageLoading, setImageLoading] = useState(false); async function handleSubmit(e){ e.preventDefault(); const formData = new FormData(); formData.append('image', image); formData.append('image1', image1); formData.append('image2', image2); formData.append('image3', image3); formData.append('price', price); formData.append('handmade', handmade); formData.append('vintage', vintage); formData.append('madeToOrder', madeToOrder); formData.append('title', title); formData.append('creator', creator); formData.append('material', material); formData.append('description', description); formData.append('user_id', userId); setImageLoading(true); // history.push("/images"); // setChange(false) } useEffect(()=>{ const fetchData = async () => { const result = await dispatch(ProductActions.getProductByIdThunk(product_id_num)); setResult(result) }; fetchData(); // Immediately in },[dispatch,product_id_num]) if (!result) { return

Create a listing

Add some photos and details about your item. Fill out what you can for now—you’ll be able to edit this later.

Photos

Add as many as you can so buyers can see every detail.

Photos *

Use up to ten photos to show your item's most important qualities.

  • Use natural light and no flash.
  • Include a common object for scale.
  • Show the item being held, worn, or used.
  • Shoot against a clean, simple background.
  • Add photos to your variations so buyers can see all their options.
setImage(e.target.files[0])} type="file" id="file-input" className="input-image1" accept="image/*" />
setImage1(e.target.files[0])} accept="image/*" />

Listing Details

Tell the world all about your item and why they’ll love it.

Title *

Include keywords that buyers would use to search for your item.

setTitle(e.target.value)} />
Handmade *

Tell the users if the design is custom.

setHandmade(true)} /> Yes, The current product is handmade
setHandmade(false)} /> No, The current product is NOT handmade
Vintage *

Tell the users if the design is custom.

setVintage(true)} /> Yes, The current product is a Vintage
setVintage(false)} /> No, The current product is a NOT Vintage
Made To Order *

Tell the users if the design is custom.

setmadeToOrder(true)} /> Yes, The product is Made to Order
setmadeToOrder(false)} /> No, The product is NOT Made to Order
Description *

Start with a brief overview that describes your item’s finest features. Shoppers will only see the first few lines of your description at first, so make it count! Not sure what else to say?
